title: City watchdog slaps TP Icap with £15m fine for misconduct by brokers
text:
The City watchdog has fined broker Tullett Prebon £15.4m for improper trading and for not being open and co-operative with investigators.

Tullett Prebon, now part of FTSE 250 firm TP Icap, had "ineffective controls around broker conduct", the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) found. The findings relate to behaviour between 2008 and 2010.

The company carried out "wash trades" - transactions with no legitimate commercial purpose - to generate "unwarranted and unusually high amounts of brokerage for the firm", the FCA said.

The wash trades and other misconduct stemmed from "lavish entertainment and a lack of effective controls" at the company.
